ygData.subject: Re: [RE: [RE: [RE: [eqbards] Need assistance please  ]    ]  ]
ygData.msgSnippet: Wow! that would make a huge difference! I am on the Karana server. :-) Melodii ... of ... fights ... lol@rpgdungeon.com ...
ygData.messageBody:
Wow! that would make a huge difference! I am on the Karana server. :-)

Melodii

"Kimes, Dean W." <dean_kimes@...> wrote:

> What server is this on? If some of the wealthier bards could help her out
> with a couple pieces of jewelry it could make a huge difference. There are
> Gold-Fire Opal rings that are AC4, +45hp. 90 Hp is a huge deal at 11th
> level.
>
> Kit
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Lisa [mailto:Lilyanatwin@...]
> Sent: Thursday, April 13, 2000 12:28 PM
> To: eqbards@egroups.com
> Subject: Re: [RE: [RE: [eqbards] Need assistance please ] ]
>
>
> There has been nothing in the information that I've received about the
> fights
> being timed. We are being assigned squares on the chessboard and there will
> be
> a cleanup crew taking care of the skel spawns.
>
> Melodii
>
> Lonnie Lewis <llewis@...> wrote:
>
> > The rules for this fight are a bit more complicated, If this is the one
> I'm
> > thinking about.
> >
> > It's near the chessboard, and the fighting "arena" is just off the side
of
> > the chessboard, with a 2 min-5 min?? timer. So the long, dragging
fights
> > that bards are good at aren't really possible :(
> >
> > So basically, bards are pretty much out of luck against anything other
> than
> > pure casters.
> >
> > Bien
> >
> > > -----Original Message-----
> > > From: kim@... [SMTP:kim@...]
> > > Sent: Thursday, April 13, 2000 1:12 PM
> > > To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
> > > Subject: RE: [RE: [eqbards] Need assistance please ]
> > >
> > > On Thu, 13 Apr 2000, Webber, Jessica wrote:
> > > > Melodii wrote:
> > > > > I'm lined up to fight a lvl 15 mag. Hmmmm....
> > > >
> > > > ???!!! And your level 11? This looks like a job for the dynamic duo
> of
> > > > Rokenn & John Kim! (Didn't at least one of say you like being
> presented
> > > > with challenges that cause you to find new ways of playing a
> character?)
> > >
> > > >
> > > > In truth, if the mage were level 11 I'd still place bets against you.
> > > > Sorry. They've got some pretty good pets.
> > >
> > > You don't have many tools at level 11.
> > >
> > > If it's an anything-goes fight (which I'd assume it is if a
> > > level 15 is fighting a level 11), I would kick in Accel, wait
> > > for him to order his pet to attack me, then quickly drag the
> > > pet out of command range and through a bunch of hostile mobs
> > > (arc your path so you don't go through the mobs but the pet
> > > does).
> > >
> > > If you don't want to be quite so dirty, I'd drag the pet away,
> > > run back and attack the mage, drag the pet away again when it
> > > returns, repeat. You can use Warsong and melee to hope to
> > > interrupt his casting, or Accel to try to get out of range
> > > before his spell fires (note that neither consumes mana, so
> > > you'd be relying on fizzles to deplete his mana). And if the
> > > pet roots you...
> > >
> > > The key I think is that you can stay out of attack range and
> > > heal indefinitely, while he cannot (gotta run out of bandages
> > > some time).
> > >
> > > --
> > > John H. Kim
> > > kim@...
> > >
> > >
> > >
